Posts.Content: dsus4 wrote: So, just found out my mother has a lung mets.  She is early 60's, is 11 years out from stage III, and has had a good number of years since then.  They caught it on an x-ray, and then completed a PET/CAT scan, bone scan and a number of other tests.  The tumor is approximately 2 cm in size, and is located at the top outside portion of one of her lungs.  Nothing else was found anywhere by any of the scans, so we're thankful for that.  Surgery is being scheduled, her doc wants to remove that chamber of the lung and then start chemo treatments.  Possibily radiation, but he isn't sure yet.  Her doc seems to have high hopes and is confident on getting everything.  Most of the info I've come across regarding lung mets isn't good, so I guess I'm getting more worried.  Any thoughts on a reasonable prognosis given the circumstances?  I just want to find out all that I can. Thanks... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lung mets dsus4 Mellaluka
